definition: to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: I can think of the most romantic thing is to learn social dance.
sentences.chinese: 我能想到的最浪漫的事，就是学会跳交谊舞。

sentences.english: Dancing or ballroom dancing in particular, used to be very popular among universities.
sentences.chinese: 跳舞，跳交谊舞，原本在大学中是很流行的。

sentences.english: Do the young people here like the social dance too?
sentences.chinese: 这里的年轻人也喜欢跳交谊舞吗？

sentences.english: You know, cotillions really are instructive.
sentences.chinese: 交谊舞确实是很有教育意义的。

sentences.english: We teach the full range of ball-room dances.
sentences.chinese: 我们教授所有的交谊舞。

sentences.english: Mary is a professor of ballroom dancing.
Learn the import of Cuban motions in ballroom dance in this free dancing video lesson.
sentences.chinese: 了解了古巴进口动议交谊舞在这个自由跳舞的视频课。

sentences.english: Dancing, ballroom dancing was originally very popular in universities.
sentences.chinese: 跳舞，跳交谊舞，原本在大学中是很流行的。

sentences.english: Learn to merengue and ballroom dance in this free dancing video lesson.
sentences.chinese: 学习梅伦格和交谊舞在这个自由跳舞的视频课。

sentences.english: Learn to swing and ballroom dance in this free dancing video lesson.
sentences.chinese: 学习Swing和交谊舞在这个自由跳舞的视频课。

sentences.english: We invite you to stay behind for lunch, enjoy the sweets and fellowship with one another.
sentences.chinese: 我们邀请你留步午餐交谊，享受点心。

sentences.english: I wasn't even going to cotillion, last week.
sentences.chinese: 上个星期我说我不想去这个交谊舞会。

sentences.english: Sorry, I'm engaged for the social dance.
sentences.chinese: 抱歉，这曲交谊舞我已经有约在先了。

sentences.english: Club dancing is more popular among teenagers than is social dancing.
sentences.chinese: 俱乐部舞蹈比交谊舞更受青少年的欢迎。

sentences.english: Please abide by the using rules of the meeting place.
Donat let just some dispute stop working a great friendship.
sentences.chinese: 不要让小小的争端损毁了一场宏大的交谊。

definition: to have friendly relationships/circle of friends
antiphon (i.e. solo voice answered by chorus)/sung reply (in agreement with first voice)/to reply with a poem in the same rhythm
to meet (in person)/to meet with sb
friend from whom you can seek advice
to have a discussion in a group/to have a chat with sb
